column1: Area Manager - IMF & New Growth Initiatives
column2: You will play a key role in driving strategic initiatives and managing operations within your assigned area       You will be responsible for identifying new growth opportunities, developing business plans, and overseeing the implementation of initiatives to achieve organizational objectives     This position requires strong leadership skills, business acumen, and the ability to drive innovation and change         Responsibilities         Strategic planning: Develop and implement strategic plans to drive growth and expansion in the assigned area     Analyze market trends, competitive landscape, and customer needs to identify new business opportunities and potential growth areas     Collaborate with senior management to define strategic priorities and align initiatives with the overall organizational strategy     New growth initiatives: Identify, evaluate, and prioritize new growth initiatives, such as new products, markets, partnerships, or acquisitions     Conduct market research, feasibility studies, and financial analysis to assess the viability and potential impact of new initiatives     Develop business cases, including financial projections, risk assessments, and implementation plans     Business development: Lead business development efforts to secure new IMF projects, contracts, and partnerships within the assigned area     Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including government agencies, international organizations, and private sector entities     Represent the organization in meetings, conferences, and networking events to promote the organization's services and capabilities     Project management: Oversee the implementation of IMF projects and initiatives within the assigned area     Develop project plans, set milestones, and allocate resources to ensure timely and successful project execution     Monitor project progress, identify and mitigate risks, and resolve issues to ensure project deliverables are achieved within budget and quality standards     Performance monitoring and reporting: Establish performance metrics and targets for the assigned area     Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to track the progress of initiatives and projects     Prepare regular reports and presentations for senior management, highlighting achievements, challenges, and recommendations for improvement     Stakeholder engagement: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to foster effective communication, collaboration, and alignment of objectives     Engage with government officials, regulatory bodies, and industry associations to stay informed of policy changes, industry trends, and potential opportunities or risks         Qualifications         Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or a related field     A master's degree or MBA is preferred     Proven experience in strategic planning, business development, or project management, preferably in the financial sector or international organizations     Strong knowledge of financial markets, IMF operations, and economic trends     Demonstrated experience in driving new growth initiatives, including market analysis, business case development, and project implementation     Excellent leadership and management skills, with the ability to inspire and lead a team     Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to make data-driven decisions     Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels     Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships with diverse stakeholders     Proficiency in financial analysis, including financial modeling and forecasting     Ability to travel domestically and internationally as required
column11: Service delivery, human capital, Excel, Finance, Banking, Sales process, Customer experience, Management, Financial services

column2: Technology underpins our entire business. Our Technology, Data, and Innovation (TDI) strategy is focused on strengthening engineering expertise, transforming, and modernizing the bank's business technology stack to meet the business goals. We continue to invest and build a team of visionary tech talent, providing you with the training, freedom, and opportunity to do pioneering work. Investment Banking, AFC and Compliance technology (IB &AFCC technology) team have global presence with 4500+ employees, including 1800+ employees in India region. Our vision is to develop cutting edge software and platforms to build sustainable revenues for the Investment Banking business and investing in technology capabilities to add value to our clients. We support Fixed Income Currencies, Origination and Advisory, Anti-financial Crime and Compliance businesses along with the technology groups like Regulatory Cross Product Technology, Deal Lifecycle Technology, Post Trade Automation Technology. We collaborate with our business partners to deliver our committed business outcomes and benefits to the Investment Bank, AFC and Compliance. Our focus is on solving business problems in the right way, delivering technology aligned to our target-state data and application Architecture. Further simplify our technology landscape, decommission legacy platforms and applications and build out our strategic platforms. Position Specific Responsibilities and Accountabilities Head of markets connectivity is responsible for the strategy and management of systems/platforms relevant to markets participation for IB business globally, and responsible for achieving the technology objectives aligned to the trading platforms. The responsibilities will also include the developing and managing connectivity and integration of systems with banks electronic trading platforms. Drive strategies for the development and maintenance of IT systems across various functions - Client and market Connectivity Management of stakeholders in business locations across geographies for alignment of IT delivery with business and broader IT division priorities. Liaising with other TDI divisions for enhancing the market connectivity/participation platforms and to promote innovative solutions. Ensure growth of engineering capability in region along with Innovation Upskill and transform the function to drive and support the global strategic program for IBAFCC technology. Helps to create and oversee project budgets and engages in cost management strategies. Knowledgeable of investment banking, sales & trading, asset management and similar industries Experience/ Exposure Managed relationships global business stakeholders, technology architecture and delivery teams. Expertise in designing trading systems connectivity software platforms, knowledge of enterprise level markets connectivity for trading technology in EQT, FIC technology and other core trading tech domains. Understanding of Financial exchange structure (memberships, markets, segments etc.) and knowledge of European and US exchange tech platforms Lead from the front as a hands-on subject matter expert, architecting and crafting scalable solutions, and driving data excellence across the organization. Experience in attracting, leading, and developing a diverse pool of developers in a distributed global organization. Experience with modern databases, cloud environments, and data ecosystems Strong problem-solving skills, experienced in structuring, leading, and delivering large scale change with diverse and distributed stakeholders. Excellent multi-channel communication skills, with proven experience of engaging and influencing both internal and external senior stakeholders. Experiences in Banking/ Financial Services domain and understanding regulatory obligations would be a plus.
column10: Investment Banking / Venture Capital / Private Equity
column11: asset management, cloud, FIC, data ecosystems, Financial Services, EQT, sales

column2: The incumbent will be responsible for LC, Guarantees, Payments and Other Miscellaneous activities as per Bank's internal policies, SOP s as well as ICC guidelines and authorising the transactions in the processing system.      The coverage will be all the areas of Trade Finance for various business segments     Ensure all KPI s are met. No miss out on due date payments. Zero TAT misses. No Ops Loss , to be ensured     Meeting DCFC control requirements     Customer satisfaction and control effectiveness     All controls specified to be met. All transactions/payments to be processed as per relevant SOP/OPM and Bank s policies/guidelines     All processing should be as per SOP/OPM s and UCP/ISBP/ISP as applicable and charges recovery to be as per the extant guidelines.     Perform sanction checking of relevant parties in documents.     Handle Trade Operations.     Responsible for authorizing/inputting transactions into the system and prepare/authorize relevant SWIFT messages.     Ad-hoc tasks given by the Team Head     Ensure errors/knowledge gaps are shared with line manager/team to address customer service issues.     No revenue leakage due to miss out in charges collection     No outstanding reconciliation entries pending in Nostro or Internal accounts.         Operating Environment, Framework and Boundaries, Working Relationships         Multi-discipline, multi-cultural work force involving financial and non-financial processes across UAE IBG     Competitive environment, constant endeavor to maintain edge in the market, Quality of service is the key in this model, has to cater to different business segments(CIBG/RBG/IBG) as per distinguished needs. Understanding and accurate analysis/interpretation of ICC publication as well as remaining abreast to the global compliance scenarios, Trade Based Money Laundering as well as Geo political situations is considered being proactive.         Managing customers expectations, Ideation and working on automation projects     Participating in Team Huddles and showing enough Teamwork to provide solutions to any issues     Ensure solutions are implemented on fast track basis and work closely with onshore unit to ensure seamless client delivery.     Audit observations if any, must be closed in an effective and timely manner.         Ensures efficient processing of transactions, adherence to service standard and quality services to both internal and external customers.     Acts as an authorizer/maker for Import LG issuance / Amendments / cancellation and/or similar stages for Standby Letter of Credits/Claims.     Ensures that the practice and procedures stated in relative manual have been strictly followed during the course of transaction processing.     Recommends actions in relation to changes in law, Rules of International Chamber of Commerce, Government regulations and bank policies which will affect the import scenario.         Decision Making Authority Responsibility         Taking corrective and preventive action based on Customer complaints, Ops error and quality/RCSA analysis.     Recommend changes in SOP, OPM ADM with an aim to improve service levels without compromising on controls.     Recommend trainings and workshops to plug knowledge gap and embed Ownership of resolution at grass-root level for effective results     Immediately escalates any error/customer complaints/service defect/issues raised by counter party to the manager.     Shares responsibility with his/her seniors.     Team management skills.         Knowledge, Skills and Experience         Bachelors Degree     At least 6-8 years of relevant working experiences in Trade Operations     Expert level knowledge in Understanding of Letter of Guarantee and Letter of Credit     Expert level knowledge of accounting entries and UATs.     Understanding of amortization principles     Good communication skills, Team Management and interpersonal skills     Proficiency in MS Office (Word and Excel)     Attentive to details, good analytical skills and interpersonal skills     Able to work under pressure, excellent organizational skills and good team player.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Job Overview:  We are seeking a motivated and dynamic Sales Executive to join our team, focused on expanding our network of Direct Selling Agents (DSAs) in the designated area for vehicle loans. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in sales, a knack for networking, and the ability to drive results through effective communication and relationship-building. Responsibilities: Develop and execute a strategic plan to recruit, train, and manage a network of DSAs specializing in vehicle loans. Identify potential DSAs through market research, referrals, and cold calling, and effectively communicate the benefits of partnering with our organization. Conduct regular meetings and training sessions with DSAs to ensure they are equipped with the necessary knowledge and resources to effectively promote and sell vehicle loans. Collaborate with internal teams, including marketing and product development, to develop promotional materials and campaigns tailored to the needs of DSAs. Build and maintain strong relationships with DSAs, providing ongoing support, feedback, and motivation to drive performance and meet sales targets. Prepare regular reports and presentations on DSA performance, sales activity, and market insights for management review. Candidate will be required to followup on the leads provided by the DSA and complete the file and the required documents Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field preferred. Proven track record of success in sales, with a minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in the financial services industry. Strong networking and relationship-building skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively. Self-motivated and results-oriented, with a demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in MS Office suite and CRM software preferred. Valid driver's license and willingness to travel within the designated area as needed. Perks and benefits     Competitive salary and performance-based incentives. Comprehensive health benefits package. Performance-based incentives

column2: Company Description SMC Insurance Brokers Pvt Ltd is a Direct Insurance Broker registered with the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI). Based in Delhi, we offer a wide range of insurance services, including life and non-life insurance, corporate business, and retail listing. We have established partnerships with car dealerships across India, providing motor insurance to customers. With over 100 years of domain experience, we are dedicated to serving our clients and providing them with comprehensive support. Job Title:  Area Manager - POS Vertical  Job Location:  Noida/Gurugram. Responsibilities Recruiting a team of financial advisors on commission basis and generate the business. Monitoring & following process for driving sales through your advisors. Doing Performance Review of your Advisors. Delivering consistent sales output utilizing your management & monitoring capabilities. Maintaining a deep knowledge of company products and services. Building and maintaining strong relationships with prospective and existing clients. Requirement & Skills Proven experience in sales, preferably in the insurance industry Deeply Knowledge about the General Insurance Product or Life Insurance Product. Ability to work with computers and understand and interpret standard statistical findings Goal-oriented Decent skills in communication and presentation Experience in delivering client-focused solutions and in creating long-lasting relationships Graduation Degree. Interested candidates can share cv on my e-mail sofia@smcinsurance.com.

column2: Job Description: Area Sales Manager - Direct Sales (B2C) Company Overview: Renewbuy is a leading Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) insurance company committed to revolutionizing the insurance sector through innovation, customer-centricity, and a focus on providing seamless experiences to our clients. With a strong presence in the insurance market, we are dedicated to offering comprehensive insurance solutions tailored to meet the evolving needs of our customers. Position Overview: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Area Sales Manager to join our team and lead our Direct Sales (B2C) division in the Delhi-NCR region. As an Area Sales Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing a team of Relationship Managers (RMs) and agents, driving sales performance, and ensuring the achievement of targets. The ideal candidate will have a background in insurance sales, a proven track record of team management, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer service. Location: Subhash Nagar, Delhi Shalimar Bagh, Delhi Kalkaji, Delhi Gurgaon Key Responsibilities: Lead and manage a team of Relationship Managers (RMs) and agents to achieve sales targets and KPIs in the assigned territory. Develop and implement strategic sales plans to drive business growth and expand market share in the Direct Sales (B2C) segment. Provide coaching, training, and guidance to RMs and agents to enhance their selling skills, product knowledge, and customer engagement abilities. Identify and cultivate new business opportunities by building strong relationships with customers and key stakeholders. Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics, identify areas for improvement, and take proactive measures to address challenges and optimize results. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and company policies, including adherence to ethical selling practices and data protection guidelines.

column2: Young bankers at Axis Bank operate in a variety of fast paced roles which offer a holistic exposure across the key areas of banking including sales, relationship management, investment products and others. These are predominantly customer facing sales roles.        Key Responsibilities          Sell financial products to the banks existing and new customers that would best fulfil the customer s needs by developing an understanding of the banks offerings and multiple product portfolios as per the business requirements      Generate leads (new/through engagement with existing customers) to position and drive the key value drivers for the bank use the bank s digital assets, increase deposits and drive investment in various financial products through direct/indirect sales      Drive fee income through cross selling of allied products and services including loans, credit/debit cards, lockers, forex, insurance, mutual funds and others      Interact with customers on a day to day basis via customer visits/calling/in branch engagement to sell/cross-sell, service their requests, and understand their needs. Develop a sense of trust with the customer and strive to build long term relationships      Maintain high standards of ethics and integrity and ensure compliance to the banks rules and operating procedures      Complete mandatory certifications and continually refresh and upgrade knowledge on the banks procedures and product portfolio.              Role Proficiencies:          Product and Services Knowledge      Process Knowledge & Process Orientation      Regulatory and Compliance Knowledge      Basic Financial Awareness      Customer Relationship Management and Selling Skills      Demonstrate positive traits like: being supportive, collaborative, ensure timely response, teamwork, flexibility, respect      Ability to communicate effectively and establish trust

column2: Job Purpose : The role entails managing and scaling up the retail branch banking business for the region by implementing strategies to achieve growth targets. It is accountable to ensure expansion of branch footprint, product penetration and delivery of high quality customer service. The role bearer is responsible for identifying business potential areas for an acquisition of Current Account customers in assigned geographies and using enablers to guide a team to successfully converting the same. The role has a P&L responsibility contributing to the larger branch banking channel objectives. Roles & Responsibilities: Mentoring a team of Sales Managers across assigned command area of branches Identifying leads for an acquisition of potential customers for assets products thus generating fee-based revenues Monitoring daily sales call to ensure acquisition process is followed including market coverage Activating Current accounts clients on transactions, thereby responsible for current account float delivery against assigned targets Imparting & refreshing product knowledge to team members, ensure complete updated product awareness within the team Responsible of timely resolution of customer queries Ensuring right level of staffing in the region for CA team Maintaining low team attrition Managing customer centric operations and ensuring customer satisfaction by achieving delivery & service quality norms Evaluate the growth strategy based on competitor analysis and feedback from different channels/customers Recommend process changes in order to improve service efficiency and quality across the branch network Monitor the growth and execution as per the defined business plan Managerial & Leadership Responsibilities: Attract and retain best-in-class talent for key roles in their reporting structure Monitor key parameters on employee productivity, hiring quality and attrition rates and make necessary improvements Enable teams to drive growth targets by providing necessary support Educational Qualifications: Graduate  Any Post Graduate - Finance (MBA preferred)

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual to join our team as an Institutional Sales professional in the broking industry       The primary responsibility of this role is to develop and maintain strong relationships with institutional clients, including hedge funds, asset managers, insurance companies, and pension funds     The Institutional Sales professional will be responsible for driving revenue growth through the acquisition of new clients and the expansion of business with existing clients                    Key Responsibilities                   ?       1. Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to meet revenue targets and drive business growth in the institutional segment.         2. Identify and target potential institutional clients through market research, networking, and cold calling.         3. Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers at institutional clients, including portfolio managers, traders, and research analysts.         4. Understand the investment strategies and objectives of institutional clients and provide tailored solutions to meet their needs.         5. Collaborate with internal teams, including research, trading, and operations, to ensure seamless execution and delivery of services to institutional clients.         6. Stay up-to-date with market trends, regulatory changes, and industry developments that may impact institutional clients.         7. Prepare and deliver presentations, proposals, and reports to institutional clients, highlighting the value proposition and benefits of our services.         8. Negotiate and finalize contracts and agreements with institutional clients, ensuring compliance with internal policies and regulatory requirements.         9. Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics, such as revenue, client retention, and market share, and provide regular reports to management.         10. Maintain a high level of professionalism and ethical conduct in all interactions with institutional clients and adhere to industry best practices.

Oversee and initiate follow-ups with external vendors to ensure timely query resolution/ report submission and eliminate any undue/ non-process related delays.   8. Co-ordinate with the recoveries team and generate business insights.   9. Lead a team of credit approvers to ensure portfolio quality and delinquencies.   10. [company/organization] team, you will play a crucial role in driving brand awareness, customer engagement, and revenue growth in the designated region     If you are a strategic thinker with strong leadership skills and a passion for achieving business objectives, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity       Key Responsibilities:       Activation Strategy Development:Develop and implement comprehensive activation strategies aligned with overall business goals     Conduct market research to understand regional trends, customer preferences, and competitive landscape     Team Leadership:Lead and inspire a high-performing team responsible for executing activation plans     Provide guidance, mentorship, and support to regional activation staff     Foster a collaborative and results-driven team culture     Campaign Planning and Execution:Plan and execute marketing campaigns, promotions, and events to drive brand awareness and customer engagement     Collaborate with marketing teams to ensure consistency in messaging and brand representation     Partnership Development:Identify and establish strategic partnerships with local businesses, organizations, and influencers     Negotiate and manage partnerships to maximize exposure and promotional opportunities     Performance Analysis and Reporting:Monitor and analyze the performance of activation campaigns against key performance indicators (KPIs)     Prepare regular reports on campaign effectiveness and provide insights for continuous improvement     Budget Management:Develop and manage activation budgets, ensuring efficient allocation of resources     Monitor expenditures and implement cost-saving measures where possible     Cross-functional Collaboration:Collaborate with other departments, including sales, marketing, and product development, to align activation efforts with broader business strategies     Ensure seamless communication and coordination between teams     Stakeholder Engagement:Engage with key stakeholders, including regional partners, community leaders, and government officials     Represent the company at regional events and ensure a positive brand image

column2: The primary responsibility will be to manage credit function for Medical Equipment Machinery Loans (SME) for the assigned geography.                    Principal Accountabilities                             APPROVALS                    Responsible for building of quality portfolio with a continuous growth in AUM year-on-year                  Monitor acceptable TATs in consultation with all stake holders for the Area/ Region.                  Constantly revisit lending norms to ensure lending practices in sync with market and organizational requirements                  Engage in development, implementation, review and monitoring of various Credit programs and providing training to team members to continuously upgrade on changes and developments.                    PORTFOLIO MONITORING                    Monitor assigned regions portfolio through delinquency benchmarks (bucket-wise)                  Early warning Indicators especially for large ticket loans                  Monitor Market related indicators to ensure timely corrective action                  Monthly regional reviews with Credit Managers/ CPAs and escalations of top-down important issues                  Regular competition analysis and implementing best practises from the industry.                                                PROCESS ADHERENCE AND RISK MANAGEMENT                    Ensure all credit end to end credit processes are followed within given Turnaround time (TAT)                  Analysis of credit MIS, taking corrective actions based on portfolio cuts                  Responsible for the compliance to procedures laid down for processing, sanction, documentation, and disbursement of various loan products at all the branches                  Responsible for fraud management and Legal to mitigate the risk activities                  Manage Credit appraisal and allied cost within allocated budget                  Submit Monthly Credit statistics and Report to ZCM                  Managing Internal and External Audit                    PEOPLE MANAGEMENT                    Mentor and train the Credit Managers/ peer teams                  Retention of Manpower.                    PORTFOLIO HYGIENE                    PDD monitoring and trigger management in consultation with Business team                    Job Interaction              External [Outside Magma]              Internal [Within Magma]                            Interaction with Peers in other NBFCS/Bank                          Interaction with Business vertical, Operations, Collection, legal, Admin, HR and any other team on basis of requirement.                  Co-partner with business team to achieve projected business targets                  Co-ordinate with Collections and Recovery team and generate business insights          Pre-Requisites            Qualification, Experience              Critical Skills                    Should be a qualified CA / MBA Finance with 2-5 plus years work experience in the finance industry/ NBFC/ bank on the lending side of business.                              The candidate needs to have strong underwriting experience understanding Credit related aspects and has been underwriting for Business loan/Equipment finance/LAP from past 2-3 plus years.                             Knowledge of finance market, types of products available, etc                  Ability to derive industry insights analyse best practices across industry                          Ability to analyse the portfolio risk and to deal with big ticket customers                          Strategic and analytical thinking                          Strong communication and interpersonal skills                          Problem solving and decision-making skills                             People Management Networking skills
